newsitem.title: USA: Labatt signs deal to make Lowenbrau in N. America.
newsitem.headline: Labatt signs deal to make Lowenbrau in N. America.

text.p: Labatt Brewing Co Ltd said Monday that it has singed an agreement with Lowenbrau AG of Germany, also privately-held, to make Lowenbrau beers in North America.
Labatt said the agreement is effective in Canada immediately, but Lowenbrau's current US agreement with Miller Brewing Co, a unit of Philip Morris Cos Inc, expires in September 1999.
A Labatt spokesman added that that agreement could be terminated earlier. "We are ready to move immediately" he said, "but the ball is now in Miller's Court."
He added that Lowenbrau sales in the U.S. have declined from around 1.2 million barrels annually in 1980 to about 400,000 barrels currently.
Hugo Powell, Labatt's chief operating officer for the Americas, said in a statement, "We're confident we can expand the brand's presence in the North American market."

Labatt USA imports and brews an array of specialty beers including Labatt Blue, Rolling Rock, Dos Equis and Tecate. It is a joint venture of Labatt Brewing Co Ltd, a subsidiary of Interbrew SA of Belgium, and Fomento Economico Mexicano SA de CV affiliate FEMSA Cerveza SA de CV of Mexico.
